value.title: POWERAPPS and POWER BI can do what?!? It's bananas!
value.excerpt: Patrick takes a look at how you can integrate PowerApps with Power BI to get a bananas experience. Updating the PowerApp does something special with the Power BI report.  Create a PowerApp: https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/  PowerApps custom visual: https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/powerapps-custom-visual

value.title: Power BI Bookmarks, Selections and Toggles
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can use bookmarks and selections to create interesting reports to show different aspects of your data. He also shows a very cool way to change between those selections that he picked up from one of his customers.  Bookmarks - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-desktop-bookmarks/

value.title: Power BI date table: create using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to create a Power BI date table using DAX. The end result uses a combination of the GENERATE(), ROW() and CALENDARAUTO() DAX functions to create a calculated table resulting in a Power BI date table.  Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-generate-and-row-instead-of-addcolumns-in-dax/

value.excerpt: Have you struggled when dragging month name to a chart axis and it is sorted alphabetically in Power BI Desktop? value.title: 2 ways to reduce your Power BI dataset size and speed up refresh
value.excerpt: Adam shows you two things to reduce your Power BI dataset size. These are both things he commonly sees with Power BI reports and could potentially save you a lot of space and improve refresh times along with report performance.  Data reduction techniques for import modeling: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/import-modeling-data-reduction

value.title: Drilling into drillthrough in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can use the drillthrough feature within Power BI Desktop. He also looks at how you can drill to multiple fields at the same time. value.title: Power BI Get Data: Import vs. DirectQuery vs. Live

value.title: Vaccination Tracker Part1: Get data from github and schedule refresh it

In Part 1 we will get the data from Github, publish it to a PPU workspace (we will need that later) and show you how to schedule refresh it and what to do if the option is not available.  To get the files go to Curbal Download

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day
value.excerpt: The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course aims to empower you as a report author with the technical knowledge required to create, publish, and distribute Power BI paginated reports. We recommend you watch the videos in the recorded sequence, starting with video 1 and ending with video 24.

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Get data in Power BI
value.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.
